This answer is based on various studies and data that suggest that Asian Americans have lower recidivism rates compared to other racial groups. According to a 2019 study published in the Journal of Criminal Justice, Asian Americans had a recidivism rate of 17.6%, which is significantly lower than the national average of 32.5%. These findings suggest that Asian Americans are more likely to successfully reintegrate into society and avoid committing crimes again.
